title: Punishment - hv3
description:
Deze les valt onder de arrangeerbare leerlijn van de Stercollecties voor Engels voor havo en vwo, leerjaar 3. Dit is thema 3 'Crime and justice'. Het onderwerp van deze les is: Punishment. In deze les staat gevolgen van criminaliteit (straf) centraal. Daarnaast worden ook oorzaken van criminaliteit besproken en straffen voor kindermisbruik. Ook wordt het onderwerp justice besproken en er komen vreemde straffen aan bod
De onregelmatige werkwoorden in deze les zijn: to go, to grow, to hang en to have. In de grammaticaopdracht wordt de passive (lijdende vorm) behandeld.

items.content:
The subject of this double period is causes of and justice for crime.

  • Form groups of three or four pupils.

Discuss the following questions in your group:

  • Write a list of different types of crime you can think of.
  • For each crime discuss what sentence you think is suitable.
  • Motivate your answers.
Step activiteit
activity		 leerdoel
aim		 tijd
time
introduction Find out what you already know. 10
Step 1

listening
Causes of crime

 You can understand a conversation about causes of crime and answer questions about it. 15
Step 2

reading
Justice for child rape

 You can understand a text about changing the law and answer questions about it. 15
Step 3 vocabulary and irregular verbs You can understand and use vocabulary about punishment. The irregular verbs: to go, to grow, to hang and to have. 15
Step 4

grammar
Passive voice

 You can understand and use the passive voice. 10
Step 5

speaking
Discussion about justice

You can discuss about justice.

 10
Step 6

writing
Weird sentence

 You can write about an unusual sentence. 20
Step 7 evaluation Reflecting on what you have learnt. 5

Causes of crime

You are going to listen to a conversation between Gareth and Rebecca.

  • Listen to the conversation and do assignment 1.
  • Read the questions.
  • Listen again to the conversation and do assignment 2.

Assignment 1

Copy and fill in the grid (on your own) and discuss the answers in your group.

(use key words to answer the questions)

What causes crime according to Rebecca?

What kind of crime do they talk about?

Questions

  1. Why does Rebecca think people commit crimes?
  2. What is the connection between abortion and crime rates?
  3. What does Gareth think is the psychological connection between love and criminals?
  4. Why does Rebecca think video games might not be bad?
  5. Why should you scream 'fire' if you need help?

prompt.body:
Choose the right answer(s). N.B. Two answers together constitute the correct answer!

Why does Rebecca think people commit crimes?

content.body: They are evil.
They want to hurt other people.
They want attention.
They want love.

prompt.body:
Choose the right answer. N.B. Two answers together constitute the correct answer!

What is the connection between abortion and crime rates?

content.body: People have abortions because they don't want the baby.
If evil people have children those children will be evil.
If children don't feel love they do bad things for attention.
Mothers can tell if their baby will be a criminal.

prompt.body:
Choose the right answer.

What does Gareth think is the psychological connection between love and criminals?

content.body: Criminals only love other criminals.
If you don't feel loved you may become a criminal.
Nobody loves you if you are a criminal.
Only people who aren't loved commit crimes.

prompt.body:
Choose the right answer.

Why does Rebecca think video games might not be bad?

content.body: Some games are educational.
The games keep us busy and out of trouble.
We can learn from the violence in video games.
There are some really good games out now.

prompt.body:
Choose the right answer. N.B. Two answers together constitute the correct answer!

Why should you scream 'fire' if you need help?

content.body: People are more likely to listen if they hear fire.
People think that the fire may cause problems for them.
People are more scared of fire than stealing.
You should only scream this when there is a fire.

items.content:
Justice for child rape

You are going to read a text about the punishment for child abuse.

  • Read the text and do assignment 1.
  • Read the text again and do assignment 2.

Assignment 1

On your own

  • Read the text and write headings for the paragraphs.

In your group

  • Discuss your headings.
Justice for child rape
§ 1. The country appears to be switched on to another amend-the-law mode following two dreadful cases of child rape and murder. Out of our raging fury comes all kinds of suggestions for punishments, ranging from lynch mobs to castration.
However, it is difficult to determine whether the proposed adjustments would provide the most effective and practical deterrent against such inhuman acts.

§ 2. At present, the rape charge under the Penal Code carries a mandatory jail term of between five and twenty years as well as whipping. Murder is punishable with the mandatory death penalty.
Logically, therefore it is unwise to amend the law to make rape equally subject to the ultimate punishment because that would make the rapist resort to killing his victim since he would think that he has nothing to lose.
But then rapists, as psychologists say, act large on overpowering impulse, and when committing the act,
do not stop to think about what punishment they might face.

§ 3. What is clear is that there must be a more deterrent law on rape, and if need be, a specific law on child rape.
At present, 67% of rape victims are under 16 years of age. There are calls for stiffer punishments under the Penal Code which must reflect the severity of the crime.

§ 4. Stiffer punishment could take many forms. This includes shaming the perpetrators by flogging them in public as suggested by Rais but opposed by the Bar Council, which says that it will not make a difference.
Not too long ago, the idea of castration as also brought up but has yet to be taken up by lawmakers.

§ 5. Perhaps there has to be a study as to what would deter a would-be rapist most from committing the act. If castration or the threat of it serves the purpose, then the law should be amended to provide for this.
Other changes to the criminal justice system, such as police methods and parole procedures, must also be considered.
The bottom line is to ensure the safety of our children and the security of our environment.

Source: http://www.englishdaily626.com/comprehension.php?040

prompt.body:
Choose the right answer.

What is the writer's concern in paragraph 1?

content.body: Suggestions for punishments, ranging from lynch mobs to castration.
Knowing of the dreadful cases of child rape and murder.
How to stop these dreadful acts.
Whether the proposed amendments to the law would effectively prevent such crimes.

prompt.body:
Choose the right answer.

What is the 'ultimate punishment' as stated in paragraph 2?

content.body: life imprisonment
death
castration
flogging

prompt.body:
Choose the right answer.

Why is the present law on rape not effective?

content.body: The offender knows he will not be whipped.
The offender knows he will not be hanged.
The offender knows he can act on impulse and commit the crime again.
The offender knows he will be merely jailed.

prompt.body:
Choose the right answer.

Which word denotes that rapists do not have any control over their emotions or actions?

content.body: overpowering
impulse
punishment
committing

prompt.body:
Choose the right answer.

The writer provides data that at present, 67% of rape victims are under sixteen years of age. What conclusion can you draw from this?

content.body: Parole procedures are poor.
Police methods are poor.
Laws are not strict enough.
Safety is unimportant.

prompt.body:
Choose the right answer.

The writer suggests that ...

content.body: the safety of children be ensured.
a study be done on what would discourage rapists.
police patrol the streets more regularly.
implementing castration would be more effective.

items.content:
• Study the vocabulary. (10 minutes)
  • Study the irregular verbs.
  • Do the exercises.

Woordenlijst Punishment


Tip!
Er zijn verschillende manieren om woordjes te leren.
Je kunt de woorden hardop voorlezen of overschrijven.
Het belangrijkste is dat je dit niet te lang achter elkaar doet, want dan leer je niets meer.
In twee keer 10 minuten leer je meer dan in een half uur.

Irregular Verbs

Bekijk de onderstaande kennisbank en bestudeer de volgende irregular verbs (onregelmatige werkwoorden):

  • to go
  • to grow
  • to hang
  • to have
Irregular verbs

content.body:
Fill in the correct word.

  1. Have you ever thought about what could be ?
  2. What might be the most effective to prevent crime?
  3. I don't believe the to be very effective.
  4. And is a of several years good for criminals?
  5. I really don't know what the best way is to deal with .
  6. Can a change his behaviour?
causing crimes
death penalty
jail term
rapist
punishment
perpetrators

Fill in the correct form of the irregular verb

  1. to have - I told you I had enough of this.
  2. to grow - My dad has a beard, it doesn't suit him.
  3. to go - Yesterday I to the cinema.
  4. to hang - Please, your coat in the hallway.

items.content:
The passive voice

  • Study the theory.
  • Do assignment 1 and 2.
Passive voice

Passive voice

 - extra

content.body:
Rewrite the sentences in Passive Voice using Auxiliary Verbs.

Example 1: She can do the exercise. → The exercise can be done

Example 2: We can not see him. → He can not be seen

  • I can answer the question. (by me).

Rewrite the sentences in Passive Voice using Auxiliary Verbs.

Example 1: She can do the exercise. → The exercise can be done

Example 2: We can not see him. → He can not be seen

  • She would carry the box. (by her).

Rewrite the sentences in Passive Voice using Auxiliary Verbs.

Example 1: She can do the exercise. → The exercise can be done

Example 2: We can not see him. → He can not be seen

  • You should open the window. (by you).

Rewrite the sentences in Passive Voice using Auxiliary Verbs.

Example 1: She can do the exercise. → The exercise can be done

Example 2: We can not see him. → He can not be seen

  • We might play cards. (by us).

Rewrite the sentences in Passive Voice using Auxiliary Verbs.

Example 1: She can do the exercise. → The exercise can be done

Example 2: We can not see him. → He can not be seen

  • You ought to wash the car. (by you).

values.value: The car ought to be washed

content.body:
Rewrite the sentences in Passive Voice using Auxiliary Verbs.

Example 1: She can do the exercise. → The exercise can be done

Example 2: We can not see him. → He can not be seen

  • He must fill in the form. (by him).

values.value: The form must be filled in

Rewrite the sentences in Passive Voice using Auxiliary Verbs.

Example 1: She can do the exercise. → The exercise can be done

Example 2: We can not see him. → He can not be seen

  • They need not buy bread. (by them).

Rewrite the sentences in Passive Voice using Auxiliary Verbs.

Example 1: She can do the exercise. → The exercise can be done

Example 2: We can not see him. → He can not be seen

  • He could not read the sentence. (by him).

content.body:
Rewrite the sentences in Passive Voice using Auxiliary Verbs.

Example 1: She can do the exercise. → The exercise can be done

Example 2: We can not see him. → He can not be seen

  • Will the teacher test our English? (by the teacher)?

Rewrite the sentences in Passive Voice using Auxiliary Verbs.

Example 1: She can do the exercise. → The exercise can be done

Example 2: We can not see him. → He can not be seen

  • Could Jenny lock the door? (by Jenny)?

Rewrite the sentences in Passive Voice - Present Continuous.

Example 1: The dog is biting the cat. →The cat is being bitten (by the dog).

Example 2: Is the dog biting the cat? → Is the cat being bitten (by the dog)?

  • Sheila is drinking a cup of tea. .

values.value: A cup of tea is being drunk (by Sheila)

Example 2: Is the dog biting the cat? → Is the cat being bitten (by the dog)?

items.content:
Discussion about justice

You read the text Justice for Crime, now you are going to discuss about it.

In your group discuss the following questions:

  • If the statement below frome the first paragraph is true, what would be your advice to prevent and/or punish rape?

"But then rapists, as psychologists say, act large on overpowering impulse, and when committing the act, do not stop to think about what punishment they might face. "

  • People generally feel strongly about rape. What makes the public think child rape is even worse?
  • Killing someone on impulse is called manslaughter and is considered to be a lesser crime than killing someone deliberately (murder). Should this distinction be made, as the result is the same? Should a similar distinction be made in the case of rape?

Weird sentence

You are going to read about an unusual sentence. Next you are going to write a comment.

  • Read the text and do the assignment.

Italy court orders man to buy feminist books for underage victim
24 September 2016

An Italian judge has ordered a man convicted of using an underage prostitute to buy her 30 feminist books and two feminist films. The 35-year-old man was also jailed for two years for his offence, following an investigation into a paedophile ring. The books include Anne Frank's Diary and the poems of Emily Dickinson.
Judge Paola Di Nicola reportedly hoped the books would help his 15-year-old victim understand the damage done to her dignity as a woman. However, one author whose book was among those on the list told Corriere della Sera newspaper that it would have been better if the judge had read the works to the convicted man instead. "Adolescence is not the time for reflection. What he did was much worse: an adult who, knowingly, paid for sex with a minor," said Adriana Cavarero, a philosophy professor at Verona university and author of Notwithstanding Plato.
The ruling follows a three-year investigation into a major paedophile ring in Rome that preyed on two girls aged 14 and 15 in the upmarket suburb of Parioli. The mastermind has been jailed for nine years. The teenagers were lured into sex work with cash that they used to buy new clothes and the latest mobile phones, investigators said.
Source: http://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-37461042

  1. Write a comment on the article 'Italy court orders man to buy feminist books for underage victim'.
    Write your contribution using the following prompts:
    • Mention when and where you read the article.
    • Give a summary of the article.
    • Give your opinion on the sentence of buying books for the victim.
    • Do you think the punishment is effective? Explain your answer.
    • Give three arguments in favour or against the sentence discussed in the article.

Open het werkbestand in google docs: 3.3 Punishment - Weird sentence.
